Package io.ib67.astralflow.item.builder

Class ItemBuilder<C extends ItemCategory<T>,T>

java.lang.Object
io.ib67.astralflow.item.builder.ItemBuilder<C,T>
Type Parameters:
C - The type of category
T - The type of item, which determined by the category type.
@AvailableSince("0.1.0") public final class ItemBuilder<C extends ItemCategory<T>,T> extends Object

A utility class to create & register your custom items quickly.


This "builder" doesn't create an item for you, you should consider using ItemKey.createNewItem() instead.
If you're looking for creating itemstacks conveniently, you'd better take a look at ItemStacks.builder(Material)

    • prototype

      public ItemBuilder<C,T>.WrappedBuilder prototype(T prototypeRegistry)
      Define the item prototype of the item. Type of parameter is up to the category. For example, if you're using MachineCategory as the category, then you'll give us a MachineItem as the prototype.
      Parameters:
      prototypeRegistry - The item prototype of the item.
      Returns:
      The item builder.
